  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.RemoteService, com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.SerializationPolicyProvider, de.esoco.data.SessionManager, de.esoco.data.storage.StorageAdapterRegistry, AuthenticatedService, CommandService, ProcessService, StorageService, de.esoco.lib.net.ExternalServiceAccess, de.esoco.process.ProcessExecutor, java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GwtApplicationServiceImpl

    public abstract class ProcessServiceImpl<E extends de.esoco.entity.Entity>
extends StorageServiceImpl<E>
implements ProcessService, de.esoco.process.ProcessExecutor
    The base class of ProcessService for service implementations that provide process-related functionality.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createProcessDescription

        public static de.esoco.data.process.ProcessDescription createProcessDescription(java.lang.Class<? extends de.esoco.process.ProcessDefinition> rDefClass)
        Creates a process description to be used by client code for a certain process definition and registers the definition internally so that it can be associated with the index stored in the description.
        Parameters:
        rDefClass - The process definition class
        Returns:
        A new process description of the process definition

      • setDefaultLocale

        public static void setDefaultLocale(java.util.Locale rLocale)
        Sets the default locale to be used if the client locale cannot be determined.
        Parameters:
        rLocale - The new default locale

      • createProcessDescriptions

        protected static de.esoco.data.process.ProcessDescription createProcessDescriptions(java.lang.Class<? extends de.esoco.process.ProcessDefinition> rDefClass,
                                                                                    java.util.List<de.esoco.data.process.ProcessDescription> rDescriptionList)
        Creates one or more process descriptions for a certain process definition. If the second argument is not NULL and the process definition relation ProcessRelationTypes.OPTIONAL_PROCESS_INPUT_PARAMS contains EntityRelationTypes.ENTITY_ID two descriptions will be added to the list, one for the creation of a new entity and one for the editing of an existing entity.
        Parameters:
        rDefClass - rDefinition The process definition
        rDescriptionList - A list to add the description(s) to or NULL to only return the description
        Returns:
        A new process description of the process definition

      • handleExecuteProcess

        public de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState handleExecuteProcess(de.esoco.data.process.ProcessDescription rDescription)
                                                        throws ServiceException
        Handles the ProcessService.EXECUTE_PROCESS command.
        Parameters:
        rDescription - The description of the process to execute
        Returns:
        A process state object if the process stopped for an interaction or NULL if the process has already terminated
        Throws:
        ServiceException - If the process execution fails

      • executeProcess

        protected void executeProcess(de.esoco.process.Process rProcess,
                              de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState.ProcessExecutionMode eMode)
                       throws de.esoco.process.ProcessException
        Performs the actual invocation of a process execution method.
        Parameters:
        rProcess - The process to execute
        eMode - The execution mode
        Throws:
        de.esoco.process.ProcessException - If the process execution fails

      • hasProcessAuthentication

        protected boolean hasProcessAuthentication()
        Indicates whether the application authentication is done by the (main) application process or by the client side UI. The standard value if FALSE but it will be set to TRUE if an application process is set with setApplicationProcess(Class).
        Returns:
        TRUE for process based authentication

      • initProcess

        protected void initProcess(de.esoco.process.Process rProcess,
                           org.obrel.core.Relatable rInitParams)
                    throws de.esoco.process.ProcessException,
                           ServiceException
        Initializes a new process and associates it with a reference entity if it is not NULL. Subclasses that override this method should typically invoke the superclass method first. The initialization parameters will be copied to the process, overriding any existing parameters.
        Parameters:
        rProcess - The process to initialize
        rInitParams - Optional process initialization parameters or NULL for none
        Throws:
        de.esoco.process.ProcessException - If the process initialization fails
        ServiceException - If the user is not authenticated or the preparing the process context fails

      • resetSessionData

        protected void resetSessionData(de.esoco.data.SessionData rSessionData)
        Overridden to cancel any processes that remained active in the given session when the user closed the browser window.
        Overrides:
        resetSessionData in class AuthenticatedServiceImpl<E extends de.esoco.entity.Entity>
        Parameters:
        rSessionData - The session data to reset
        See Also:
        AuthenticatedServiceImpl.resetSessionData(SessionData)

      • setApplicationProcess

        protected void setApplicationProcess(java.lang.Class<? extends de.esoco.process.ProcessDefinition> rProcessDefinition)
        Can be invoked by subclasses to set the (main) application process. This will also set the return value of hasProcessAuthentication() to true. This method should be invoked before any other process definitions are created through createProcessDescriptions(Class, List).
        Parameters:
        rProcessDefinition - The class of the application process definition

      • wrapException

        protected ServiceException wrapException(java.lang.Throwable e,
                                         de.esoco.data.process.ProcessState rProcessState)
        Wraps exceptions that may occur during the execution of one of the service methods into a ServiceException if necessary. In case of an InvalidParametersException the service exception will contain information about the invalid parameters.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception to handle
        rProcessState - The current process state
        Returns:
        The resulting ServiceException
